hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I'd like to send this letter by area clinical forum Post-Edinburgh, a different kind of breakthrough came as a result of Flanagan’s 'Out Out’ routine, a riff that he performed on BBC One’s Live at the Apollo and has since been watched more than a million times on YouTube. Only Flanagan can do it justice, but the routine’s central conceit is the way British people have different gradations of drunkenness on a night out. You might 'pop out’ for a quick pint. If you’ve committed to an evening’s drinking, you’re 'going out’. But if you find yourself at 3am in a sticky-floored nightclub shouting incoherently into a stranger’s ear, then you’ve attained the nirvana of British boozing: you’re 'out out’. Whenever Flanagan performs the 'Out Out’ routine, it invariably gets the best reception, even though his fans know every word.
